trans-unit.source: Provides common designer loader functionality that can be used to implement custom workflow designer loaders.

> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] Designer loader classes are used to load the designer and save any changes to the state of the designer when the user so instructs.
The WorkflowDesignerLoader class can be implemented to support custom loading of a workflow designer and workflow designer components.

A workflow designer loader is also responsible for writing changes to an open document back to the storage the loader used when loading the document after the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader.Flush%2A> method is called.
When implemented in a derived class, initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader"></xref> class.
Adds an activity to the designer host after it has been added to the parent activities collection.
<xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> to add.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader"></xref>.
Dispose releases all services used by the designer host, but it does not write pending changes to the designer loader.
If you want to save any pending changes prior to releasing all resources, call <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader.Flush%2A> before you call Dispose.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the file name of the designer to load.
A string that contains the file name of the designer to load.
Writes pending changes to the location that the designer was loaded from.
When overridden in a derived class, causes <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader"></xref> to reload the designer.
When overridden in a derived class, retrieves an object that <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader"></xref> uses to read from the specified file.
A string that contains a path to the file to read from.
A <xref:System.IO.TextReader> to read the specified file.
When overridden in a derived class, gets an object that the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader"></xref> uses to write to the specified file.
The following example shows how to create and return a `TextWriter` object when the GetFileWriter overloaded method is called.
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#34](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/wf_snippets/snippets.cs#34)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#34](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/wf_snippets/snippets.vb#34)]
A string that contains the path to the file to write to.
A <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> to write to the file.
Gets a value that indicates whether the workflow should be loaded in debug mode.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the workflow should be loaded in debug mode; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader"></xref> with any services required by the designer loader host.
Applies the serialized layout to the root designer in the current designer host.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> that is created for the serialized layout.
List of errors that occurred during the deserialization.

Retrieves the specified resource and calls the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader.LoadDesignerLayout*> method that applies the serialized layout to the root designer in the current designer host.
<xref:System.Type> that the resource is associated with.
Name of the resource.
Errors encountered during the call to <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader.LoadDesignerLayout*>.
Called when loading of the designer is completed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if load operation is successful; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Contains the load errors.
Writes cached changes to the location that the designer was loaded from.
Class that implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager"></xref> interface, which manages design-time serialization.
Loads the designer from a design document.
Class that implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager"></xref> interface, which manages design-time serialization.
Removes an activity from the designer host after it has been added to the parent activities collection.
Activity to be removed from the designer.
Serializes the designer layout.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlWriter" name="XmlWriter" href=""></xref> that is used to serialize the layout into.
Root activity from which you get the layout information.
Errors encountered during serialization.
Gets the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> metadata of the target [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> metadata of the target [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
